name: Target
description: The Target class contains information about the possible target(s) of the event(s) that generated an alert.  An event may have more than one target (e.g., in the case of a port sweep).

Node.name: Node
Node.description: Information about the host or device at which the event(s) (network address, network name, etc.) is being directed.

User.name: User
User.description: Information about the user at which the event(s) is being directed.

Process.name: Process
Process.description: Information about the process at which the event(s) is being directed.

Service.name: Service
Service.description: Information about the network service involved in the event(s).

File.name: File
File.description: Information about file(s) involved in the event(s).

ident.name: ident
ident.description: A unique identifier for this target, see Section 3.2.9.

decoy.name: decoy
decoy.description: An indication of whether the target is, as far as the analyzer can determine, a decoy.  The permitted values for this attribute are shown below.  The default value is "unknown".  (See also Section 10.)

values.description: Target is believed to be a decoy

interface.name: interface
interface.description: May be used by a network-based analyzer with multiple interfaces to indicate which interface this target was seen on.
